data.client_settings: "Release Channel: stable, Build Number: 29445, Version Hash: b7fbda1fde750c0db4d7e7e81dd4a573c89b3a7", also reproducible in a build at least 2 weeks old.
data.actual_result: Exactly as described in the description and repro steps
data.expected_result: I expected to only see the registry activity when Discord was visible and being interacted with
data.short_description: Discord.exe is making large amounts of redundant registry accesses even when idle
data.steps_to_repro: - Make sure the Discord client is running. It does not matter whether it is visible or idle or being interacted with. - Download procmon from and run it. - Disable all activity filters on procmon's toolbar except for Show Registry Activity. - Hold the `End` key and observe that a vast majority of the events zipping by are from , happen every second and are related to msvideo and/or Driver.
